title: nova list --ip filter shows all instances

comments.content:
The main reason why nova list values are not filtered with attribute  "ip" is because the attribute "ip" is not there in the server search options. The attributes reservation_id, name , status, image,flavor, change_since and all_tenants are there in server search options. But attribute "ip" is missing. 

Is there any specific reason for not including the attribute "ip" in server search options?
 should we include it?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~satya-patibandla-i

comments.content:

comments.content:
I am still able to repro.

This works : nova list --ip 10.0.0.1
This doesn't : nova list --ip 10.0.0.14 (return a error code 500) 

 curl -ivk -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" http://XX:8774/v2/${PROJECT_ID}/servers?ip=10.0.0.14 and browse nova log to see the exact stack trace.

The updated Nova test should test a search based on a regex (req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/fake/servers?ip=10\..*') AND also an exact search (req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/fake/servers?ip=10.0.0.14)
